text: Evaluate \(\left(\frac{81}{16}\right)^{\frac{-1}{4}}\times 2^{-1}\)
explanation:
\(\left(\frac{81}{16}\right)^{\frac{-1}{4}}\times 2^{-1}\)  =  \(\frac{1}{\left(\frac{81}{16}\right)^{\frac{1}{4}}}\times \frac{1}{2}\)= \(\left(\frac{16}{81}\right)^{\frac{1}{4}}\times \frac{1}{2}\)= \(\left(\frac{2}{3}\right)^{4\times \frac{1}{4}}\)=\(\frac{2}{3}\times \frac{1}{2}\)= \(\frac{1}{3}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Rationalize \(\frac{2\sqrt{3} + \sqrt{5}}{\sqrt{5} - \sqrt{3}}\)
explanation:
\(\frac{2\sqrt{3} + \sqrt{5}}{\sqrt{5} - \sqrt{3}}\)
= \((\frac{2\sqrt{3} + \sqrt{5}}{\sqrt{5} - \sqrt{3}})(\frac{\sqrt{5} + \sqrt{3}}{\sqrt{5} + \sqrt{3}})\)
= \(\frac{2\sqrt{15} + 6 + 5 + \sqrt{15}}{5 - 3}\)
= \(\frac{3\sqrt{15} + 11}{2}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Express the product of 0.21 and 0.34 in standard form
explanation:
0.21 x 0.34 = 0.0714= 7.14 x 10-2
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In a survey of 50 newspaper readers, 40 read Champion and 30 read Guardian, how many read both papers?
explanation:
Let C n G =Xn C only = 40 - xn G only = 30 - x40 -X+ 30 -X + X= 5070 -X= 50X= 70 - 50X= 20
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Factorize completely \(\frac{x^{3} + 3x^{2} - 10x}{2x^{2} - 8}\)
If y varies directly as the square root of x and y = 3 when x = 16. Calculate y when x = 64
explanation:
y∝ √xy= K√xK =y/√x= 3/√16= 3/4y= 3/4√x= 3/4√64 when x = 64= 3/4 x 8/1= 6
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If x * y = x + y\(^2\), find then value of (2*3)*5
explanation:
x * y = x + y\(^2\)2 * 3 = 2 + 3\(^2\)= 2 + 9= 11(2 * 3) * 5 = 11 + 5\(^2\)= 11 + 25= 36
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If p and q are two non zero numbers and 18(p+q) = (18+p)q, which of the following must be true?
explanation:
If 18(p + q) = (18 + p)q
then 18p + 18q = 18q + pq
18p = pq \(\implies\) q = 18.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If \(\begin{vmatrix} x & 3 \\ 2 & 7 \end{vmatrix} = 15\), find the value of x
explanation:
\(\begin{vmatrix} x & 3 \\ 2 & 7 \end{vmatrix} = 15\)xx 7 - 2 x 3 = 157x- 6 = 157x= 15+67x= 21x= 21/7x= 3
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: From the diagram above, find x
explanation:
∠RTS = 90o (∠ in semi circle)∠UTS = 25o (∠ in alternate segment)X+ 90 + 25 = 180(sum of ∠s on a str line)X+ 115 = 180X= 180 - 115X= 65o
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: From the cyclic quadrilateral TUVW above, find the value of x
explanation:
TUVW is a cyclic quad3χ+ 20 + 88 = 180 (opp ∠ s of a cyclic quad are supplementary)3χ+ 108 = 1803χ= 180 - 1083χ= 72χ= 72/3χ= 24o
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If two smaller sides of a right angled triangle are 4cm and 5cm, find its area
explanation:
Area of a triangle = 1/2 base x height= 1/2 x 4 x 5= 10 cm2
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: An arc subtends an angle of 50º at the center of circle of radius 6cm. Calculate the area of the sector formed
explanation:
Area of a sector = \(\frac{\theta}{360}\) x \(\pi\)r\(^2\)
= \(\frac{50}{360} \times \frac{22}{7}\) x 36= \(\frac{110}{7}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: What is the locus of point that is equidistant from points P(1,3) and Q(3,5)?
explanation:
Locus of a point equidistant from two fixed points is the perpendicular bisector of the straight line joining the points Gradients of PQ = (5-3 / 3-1) = 2/2 = 1Gradient bisector = -1Equation of perpendicular bisectory - y1= m(χ - χ1y- 4 = -χ+ 2y=-χ+ 6
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If the area of ΔPQR above is 12\(\sqrt{3}\) cm\(^2\), find the value of q?
explanation:
Area of a triangle = \(\frac{1}{2}\) ab Sinθ12\(\sqrt{3}\) = \(\frac{1}{2}\) x 8 x q sin 6012\(\sqrt{3}\) = 4 x q x \(\frac{\sqrt{3}}{2}\)12\(\sqrt{3}\) = 2q\(\sqrt{3}\)
q = \(\frac{12\sqrt{3}}{2\sqrt{3}}\)
q = 6cm.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If y = (2x + 1)\(^3\) find \(\frac{\text{d}}{\text{dx}}\)
explanation:
y = (2x + 1)\(^3\)\(\frac{dy}{dx}\) = 3(2x + 1)\(^{3-1}\) x 2= 3(2x + 1)\(^2\)x 2= 6(2x + 1)\(^2\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Find ∫(sin x + 2)dx
explanation:
∫(sin χ + 2)dχ = (∫sin χ + ∫2)dx= -cos χ + 2χ + K
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

(\(\frac{3}{4}\) of \(\frac{4}{9}\) \(\div\) 9\(\frac{1}{2}\)) \(\div\) 1\(\frac{5}{19}\)Applying the rule of BODMAS, we have:(\(\frac{3}{4}\) x \(\frac{4}{9}\) \(\div\)\(\frac{19}{2}\)) \(\div\)\(\frac{24}{19}\)(\(\frac{1}{3}\) x \(\frac{2}{19}\)) \(\div\)\(\frac{24}{19}\)\(\frac{1}{3}\) x \(\frac{2}{19}\) x \(\frac{19}{24}\)= \(\frac{1}{36}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A student measures a piece of rope and found that it was 1.26m long. If the actual length of the rope was 1.25m, what was the percentage error in the measurement?
explanation:
Actual length of rope = 1.25mMeasured length of rope = 1.26merror = (1.26 - 1.25)m - 0.01mPercentage error = \(\frac{error}{\text{actual length}}\) x 100%= \(\frac{0.01}{1.25}\) x 100%= 0.8%
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: At what rate will the interest on N400 increases to N24 in 3 years reckoning in simple interest?
explanation:
Using simple interest = \(\frac{P \times T \times R}{100}\),where: P denoted principal = N400T denotes time = 3 yearsR denotes interest rate = ?24 = \(\frac{400 \times 3 \times R}{100}\)24 x 100 = 400 x 3 x RR = \(\frac{24 \times 100}{400 \times3}\)= 2%
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

If p : q = \(\frac{2}{3}\) : \(\frac{5}{6}\), then the sum S1 of ratio = \(\frac{2}{3}\) + \(\frac{5}{6}\) = \(\frac{9}{6}\)If q : r = \(\frac{3}{4}\) : \(\frac{1}{2}\), then the sum S2 of ratio = \(\frac{3}{4}\) + \(\frac{1}{2}\) = \(\frac{5}{4}\)Let p + q = T1, thenq = (\(\frac{5}{6} \div \frac{9}{6}\))T1 = (\(\frac{5}{6} \times \frac{6}{9}\))T1 = \(\frac{5}{9}\)T1Again, let q + r = T2, thenq = (\(\frac{3}{4} \div \frac{5}{4}\))T2 = (\(\frac{3}{4} \times \frac{4}{5}\))T2 = \(\frac{3}{5}\)T2Using q = q\(\frac{5}{9}\)T1 = \(\frac{3}{5}\)T25 x 5T1 = 9 x 3T2\(\frac{T_1}{T_2}\) = \(\frac{9 \times 3}{5 x 5}\) = \(\frac{27}{25}\)Giving that, T1 = 27 and T2 = 25P = (\(\frac{2}{3} \div S_1\))T1 = (\(\frac{2}{3} \div \frac{9}{6}\))T1= (\(\frac{2}{3} \times \frac{6}{9}\))27 = 12q = (\(\frac{5}{6} \div S_1\))T1 = (\(\frac{5}{6} \div \frac{9}{6}\))T1= (\(\frac{5}{6} \times \frac{6}{9}\))27 = 15and r = (\(\frac{1}{2} \div S_2\))T2 = (\(\frac{1}{2} \div \frac{5}{4}\))T2= (\(\frac{1}{2} \times \frac{4}{5}\))25 = 10Hence p : q : r = 12: 15 : 10
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The 3rd term of an arithmetic progression is -9 and the 7th term is -29. Find the 10th term of the progression
explanation:
3rd term : a + 2d = -9 .......(1)7th term : a + 6d = -29 ......(2)(2) - (1): 4d = -20:. d = -20/4 = -5From (1) : a + 2(-5) = -9a - 10 = -9:. a = -9 + 10 = 1:. 10th term of A.P is a + 9d = 1 + 9 (-5)= 1 - 45 = -44
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: At what value of X does the function y = -3 - 2x + X2 attain a minimum value?
explanation:
Given that y = -3 - 2x + X2then, \(\frac{dy}{dx}\) = -2 + 2xAt maximum value, \(\frac{dy}{dx}\) = Otherefore, -2 + 2x2x = 2x = 2/2 = 1
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Find the equation of a line parallel to y = -4x + 2 passing through (2,3)
explanation:
By comparing y = mx + cwith y = -4x + 2,the gradient of y = -4x + 2 is m1 = -4let the gradient of the line parallel to the given line be m2,then, m2 = m1 = -4(condition for parallelism)using, y - y1 = m2(x - x1)Hence the equation of the parallel line isy - 3 = -4(x-2)y - 3 = -4 x + 8y + 4x = 8 + 3y + 4x = 11y + 4x - 11 = 0
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Make Q the subject of formula if p = \(\frac{M}{5}\)(X + Q) + 1
explanation:
p = \(\frac{M}{5}\)(X + Q) + 1P - 1 = \(\frac{M}{5}\)(X + Q)\(\frac{5}{M}\)(p - 1) = X + Q\(\frac{5}{M}\)(p - 1)- x = QQ = \(\frac{5(p -1) - Mx}{M}\)= \(\frac{5p - 5 - Mx}{M}\)= \(\frac{5p - Mx - 5}{M}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If 9x\(^2\) + 6xy + 4y\(^2\) is a factor of 27x\(^3\) - 8y\(^3\), find the other factor.
explanation:
Given that \( 9x^2 + 6xy + 4y^2 \) is a factor of \( 27x^3 - 8y^3 \), we can express:
\(27x^3 - 8y^3 = (3x - 2y)(9x^2 + 6xy + 4y^2)\)
Thus, the other factor is: 3x - 2y
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Solve for x and y if x - y = 2 and x2 - y2 = 8
If x is inversely proportional to y and x = 2\(\frac{1}{2}\) when y = 2, find x if y = 4
explanation:
x \(\alpha\) \(\frac{1}{y}\) .........(1)x = k x \(\frac{1}{y}\) .........(2)When x = 2\(\frac{1}{2}\)= \(\frac{5}{2}\), y = 2(2) becomes \(\frac{5}{2}\) = k x \(\frac{1}{2}\)giving k = 5from (2), x = \(\frac{5}{y}\)so when y =4, x = \(\frac{5}{y}\) = 1\(\frac{1}{4}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: For what range of values of x is \(\frac{1}{2}\)x + \(\frac{1}{4}\) > \(\frac{1}{3}\)x + \(\frac{1}{2}\)?
explanation:
\(\frac{1}{2}\)x + \(\frac{1}{4}\) > \(\frac{1}{3}\)x + \(\frac{1}{2}\)Multiply through by through by the LCM of 2, 3 and 412 x \(\frac{1}{2}\)x + 12 x \(\frac{1}{4}\) > 12 x \(\frac{1}{3}\)x + 12 x \(\frac{1}{2}\)6x + 3 > 4x + 66x - 4x > 6 - 32x > 3\(\frac{2x}{2}\) > \(\frac{3}{2}\)x > \(\frac{3}{2}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Solve the inequalities -6 \(\leq\) 4 - 2x < 5 - x
explanation:
-6 \(\leq\) 4 - 2x < 5 - xsplit inequalities into two and solve each part as follows:-6 \(\leq\) 4 - 2x = -6 - 4 \(\leq\) -2x-10 \(\leq\) -2x\(\frac{-10}{-2}\) \(\geq\) \(\frac{-2x}{-2}\)giving 5 \(\geq\) x or x \(\leq\) 54 - 2x < 5 - x-2x + x < 5 - 4-x < 1\(\frac{-x}{-1}\) > \(\frac{1}{-1}\)giving x > -1 or -1 < xCombining the two results, gives -1 < x \(\leq\) 5
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Find the sum to infinity of the following series. 0.5 + 0.05 + 0.005 + 0.0005 + .....
explanation:
Using S\(\infty\) = \(\frac{a}{1 - r}\)r = \(\frac{0.05}{0.5}\) = \(\frac{1}{10}\)S\(\infty\) = \(\frac{0.5}{{\frac{1}{10}}}\)= \(\frac{0.5}{({\frac{9}{10}})}\)= \(\frac{0.5 \times 10}{9}\)= \(\frac{5}{9}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Evaluate \(\begin{vmatrix} 2 & 0 & 5 \\ 4 & 6 & 3 \\ 8 & 9 & 1 \end{vmatrix}\)
If P = \(\begin{pmatrix} 2 & -3 \\ 1 & 1 \end{pmatrix}\) , what is P\(^-1\)
explanation:
P = \(\begin{pmatrix} 2 & -3 \\ 1 & 1 \end{pmatrix}\)|P| = 2 - 1 x -3 = 5P-1 = \(\frac{1}{5}\)\(\begin{pmatrix} 1 & 3 \\ -1 & 2 \end{pmatrix}\)= \(\begin{pmatrix} {\frac{1}{5}} & {\frac{3}{5}} \\ -{\frac{1}{5}} & {\frac{2}{5}} \end{pmatrix}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The interior angles of a quadrilateral are (x + 15)°, (2x - 45)°, ( x - 30)° and (x + 10)°. Find the value of the least interior angle.
explanation:
(x + 15)º + (2x - 45)º + (x + 10)º + (x - 30)º = (2n - 4)90ºwhen n = 4x + 15º + 2x - 45º + x - 30º + x + 10º = (2 x 4 - 4) 90º5x - 50º = (8 - 4)90º5x - 50º = 4 x 90º = 360º5x = 360º + 50º5x = 410ºx = \(\frac{410^o}{5}\)= 82ºHence, the value of the least interior angle is (x - 30)º= (82 - 30) º= 52º
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A cylindrical pipe 50m long with radius 7m has one end open. What is the total surface area of the pipe?
explanation:
Total surface area of the cylindrical pipe = area of circular base + curved surface area= \(\pi\)r\(^2\) + 2\(\pi\)rh
= \(\pi\) x 7\(^2\) + 2\(\pi\) x 7 x 50
= 49\(\pi\) + 700\(\pi\)
= 749\(\pi\)m\(^2\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Find the distance between the points (\(\frac{1}{2}\), \(\frac{1}{2}\)) and (-\(\frac{1}{2}\), -\(\frac{1}{2}\)).
explanation:
Let D denote the distance between (\(\frac{1}{2}\), -\(\frac{1}{2}\)) then usingD = \(\sqrt{(x_2 - x_1)^2 + (y_2 - y_1)^2}\)= \(\sqrt{(-{\frac{1}{2} - \frac{1}{2}})^2 + (-{\frac{1}{2} - \frac{1}{2}})^2}\)= \(\sqrt{(-1)^2 + (-1)^2}\)= \(\sqrt{1 + 1}\)= √2
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Find the gradient of the line passing through the points P(1, 1) and Q(2, 5).
explanation:
Let (x1, y1) = (1, 1) and (x2, y2)= (2, 5)then gradient m of \(\bar{PQ}\) ism = \(\frac{y_2 - y_1}{x_2 - x_1}\) = \(\frac{5 - 1}{2 - 1}\)= \(\frac{4}{1}\)= 4
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If cot\(\theta\) = \(\frac{8}{15}\), where \(\theta\) is acute, find sin\(\theta\)
explanation:
cot\(\theta\) = \(\frac{1}{\cos \theta}\)= \(\frac{8}{15}\)(given)tan\(\theta\) = \(\frac{15}{8}\)By Pythagoras' theorem,x\(^2\) = 15\(^2\) + 8\(^2\)x\(^2\) = 225 + 64 = 289x = \(\sqrt{289}\)= 17Hence sin\(\theta\) = \(\frac{15}{x}\)= \(\frac{15}{17}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If y = x sinx, find \(\frac{dy}{dx}\)
explanation:
If y = x sinx, thenLet u = x and v = sinx\(\frac{du}{dx}\) = 1 and \(\frac{dv}{dx}\) = cosxHence by the product rule,\(\frac{dy}{dx}\) = v \(\frac{du}{dx}\) + u\(\frac{dv}{dx}\)= (sin x) x 1 + x cosx= sinx + x cosx
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Evaluate \(\int^{2}_{0}(x^3 + x^2)\)dx.
In how many ways can a committee of 2 women and 3 men be chosen from 6 men and 5 women?
explanation:
A committee of 2 women and 3 men can be chosen from 6 men and 5 women, in \(^{5}C_{2}\) x \(^{6}C_{3}\) ways= \(\frac{5!}{(5 - 2)!2!} \times {\frac{6!}{(6 - 3)!3!}}\)= \(\frac{5!}{3!2!} \times {\frac{6!}{3 \times 3!}}\)= \(\frac{5 \times 4 \times 3!}{3! \times 2!} \times {\frac{6 \times 5 \times 4 \times 3!}{3! \times 3!}}\)= \(\frac{5 \times 4}{1 \times 2} \times {\frac{6 \times 5 \times 4}{1 \times 2 \times 3}}\)= 10 x \(\frac{6 \times 20}{6}\)= 200
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If three unbiased coins are tossed, find the probability that they are all heads
explanation:
P(H) = \(\frac{1}{2}\) and P(T) = \(\frac{1}{2}\)Using the binomial prob. distribution,(H + T)3 = H3 + 3H2T1 + 3HT2 + T3Hence the probability that three heads show in a toss of the three coins is H3= (\(\frac{1}{2}\))3= \(\frac{1}{8}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Find the standard deviation of 2, 3, 5 and 6
W is directly proportional to U. If W = 5 when U = 3, find U when W = \(\frac{2}{7}\)
explanation:
W \(\alpha\) UW = kuu = \(\frac{w}{k}\); \(\frac{2}{7}\) x \(\frac{3}{5}\)= \(\frac{6}{35}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Determine the value of x for which (x\(^2\) - 1)>0
explanation:
(x\(^2\) - 1) > 0
x\(^2\) > 1
Taking the square root of both sides
x >1 or x < -1
There is an explanation video availablebelow.
